Title: NDDC urges Niger Delta youths to embrace tech opportunities
Summary: NDDC urges Niger Delta youths to embrace tech opportunities . Youths urged to explore opportunities in advanced technology to become valuable to themselves and others .

Title: Taraba Bye-election: APC appoints Yari, Kalu, others as campaign council members
Summary: APC appoints former Zamfara State Governor, Sen. Abdulaziz Yari, as chairman of campaign council . Also appointed as co-chairmen of the campaign council in Karim 1, Taraba State constituency election .

Title: Tinubu unveils multi-billion-dollar investments in steel, aluminium sector
Summary: Tinubu unveils multi-billion-dollar investments in steel, aluminium sector . Key projects expected to come onstream within the next six years .

Title: Ayo Babalola’s daughter to Fatoyinbo: Verify facts before speaking on pulpit
Summary: First daughter of Apostle Joseph Ayo Babalola urges pastors to verify facts before speaking on pulpit . Pastor Biodun Fatoyinbo of the Commonwealth Church has made recent remarks .

Title: Oborevwori rewards world debate champions with N20m each
Summary: Delta State Governor, Rt. Hon. Sheriff Oborevwori, rewarded each member of the state’s victorious debate team with N20 million for winning the 2025 World Basic Schools Debate Championship held in Doha, Qatar .

Title: Council Poll: APC vows to capture all 23 LGAs in Rivers
Summary: Chief Victor Giadom has expressed confidence that the party will win all 23 local government areas in Rivers State . He spoke at the APC campaign flag-off for the August 30 elections in Rivers .

Title: CUPP to SMBLF: INEC, FG’s interference responsible for Labour Party crisis — CUPP
Summary: Coalition of United Political Parties faulted the Southern and Middle Belt Leaders Forum (SMBLF) over its position on the crisis in the Labour Party . INEC, FG’s interference responsible for Labour Party crisis — CUPP .

Title: Ibom Air: Intl rights activist Saidu berates FG, calls for review of passenger incident
Summary: International rights activist, Alaji Musa Musa Saidu, has criticised the Federal Government’s handling of the recent incident involving Ibom Air passenger, Miss Comfort Bob . Saidu has called for a review of how passenger-related disputes are addressed .

Title: Nigeria accounts for 70% of 11m illegal arms in West Africa
Summary: The National Center for the Control of Small Arms and Light Weapons (NCCSALW) says that Nigeria is accountable for 70 percent of the 11 million illegal arms and light weapons in West Africa .

Title: Troops rescue 38 kidnapped victims, arrest 82 bandits and kidnappers
Summary: Troops rescued 38 kidnapped victims and arrested 82 suspects, including terrorist collaborators and oil theft perpetrators . In ongoing operations to eliminate armed bandits, dismantle terrorist networks, and combat criminal activities nationwide, troops deployed across various theatres .

Title: EFCC denies targeting Obasanjo library in arrest of 93 suspected fraudsters
Summary: The Olusegun Obasanjo Presidential Library in Abeokuta, Ogun State, was not the target of its recent operation in which 93 suspected internet fraudsters were arrested . The management of the Presidential Library on Wednesday demanded N3.5 billion in compensation and a public apology from the EFCC .

Title: PIA: NGO urges oil firms to remit 3% to Imo host communities
Summary: A non-governmental organisation, Connected Development, called for the timely disbursement of the 3% by the Board of Trustees into the Host Communities Development Trust Fund . The Trust Fund is meant to provide a framework for the development of the communities .

Title: COZA's Fatoyinbo apologises after backlash over ‘no money’ comment on CAC's Ayo Babalola
Summary: Pastor Biodun Fatoyinbo of Commonwealth of Zion Assembly has recanted and apologised to Christ Apostolic Church over comments he made about the late Apostle Joseph Ayo Babalola . In a now-viral clip, he described the late evangelist as “anointed… so anointed” but claimed that �

Title: APC’ll win all 23 LGs in Rivers, Giadom, Okocha boast
Summary: National Vice Chairman of the All Progressives Congress, South-South, Chief Victor Giadom, has expressed confidence that the August 30 local government elections in Rivers State will be an easy victory for the party . The State Chairman, Chief Tony Okocha, said the APC is participating in the forthcoming polls because the Rivers State Independent

Title: Enugu gov lauds Tinubu on fuel subsidy, FX reforms
Summary: Enugu State Governor, Peter Mbah, has commended President Bola Tinubu for his tough and decisive decisions on fuel subsidy removal and the unification of currency exchange rates . Mbah said the bold initiatives have freed up funds for development projects at the state level . The governor also showcased some of the state’s development projects
